Comment 4: 
The "godoc" command was always there, and it is the same as it ever was.

The "go doc" command was a wrapper around "godoc" that uses the "go" tool's path
expansion logic. That was removed in Go 1.2, causing this loss of functionality.

I apologize if that's frustrating for you. You can write a small shell script that uses
"go list" and "godoc" to achieve the same result.
